The text is mainly talking about ……… power
questionsData.article:
Wind power is the energy, such as electricity that is generated directly from the wind. (It 1) is considered a
renewable energy source because there is always wind on the earth, which means we aren't using up the wind
when we make energy from it. Wind power also does not cause (pollution 2). In order to make electricity from
wind, energy companies use (large 3) windmills called wind turbines. They are called like this because they use
turbine generators to generate the electricity. Wind turbines are really big structures. The tower itself is typically
between 200 and 300 feet tall. Wind turbines work the opposite of a fan. Instead of using electricity to turn the
blades to make wind, it uses the wind to turn the blades to make electricity. If there isn't any wind, then no energy
will be generated by wind turbines. However, engineers do a lot of measurements and calculations to find out the
best areas to place the wind turbines. The wind won't be blowing all the time, but the important thing is how much
the wind blows on average.
